headline: Psalm of the Open Door
description: A quiet psalm of obedience and faith in unknowing — a reflection on trust, imperfection, and the first steps beyond the ash of old trials. The pilgrim acknowledges both blindness and belief, finding holiness in motion itself.

timeFelt.phase: Ash Moon Ascending (🕊 The Door of Trust)

resonantThread: Faith born from uncertainty; obedience as first light after ruin.
whyItMatters: This psalm marks the gentle passage from inner surrender to outer motion. It captures the moment faith ceases to be a feeling and becomes a walk — a quiet covenant of trust with the unseen.

motifMap.meaning: Faith without sight; peace through surrender.
Threshold between knowing and doing — obedience as entryway.
Ash transformed into devotion; the rebirth of will.

articleExcerpt: Sometimes, when God opens a door, and you think it is the right one, the excitement is muted—or too much to contain. For even Moses, in a small act, cost himself the promised land. Yet I walk each day in trust, imperfect but answering the call.
sourceFragments: “For even Moses, in a small act, cost himself the promised land.”
“I walk each day in trust. I walk each day blind — but with vision.”
“I am imperfect, like this poem. But I trust in the call. I am trying to answer.”

associatedMedia.description: Original Substack post from Wanderer’s Burn — Psalm of the Open Door, October 22, 2025.
